stimulusHtml: Which of the following is the most likely immediate effect of an increase in runoff containing cadmium on the trophic structure of the river community?

features.html:
High concentrations of cadmium in the water negatively affect steelhead trout. In a river community, steelhead trout are part of the trophic structure shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. The trophic structure of a river community

choicesHtml: The population of Cladophora will decrease, resulting in an increase in the trout population.
There will be a large decrease in the trout population, resulting in an increase in damselfly nymphs.
Increased stream volume will provide more area for the trout to reproduce, causing a large increase in the population of algae.
The population of trout will decrease because the population of damselfly nymphs will decline.
